alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 4:42PM EDT until September 09 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey...including the following county...Morris. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. 1 to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Morristown, Madison, Florham Park, East Hanover, Chatham, Boonton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mountain Lakes, Parsippany, Hanover Township, and White Meadow Lake. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 38 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 34 and 46. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
